column1: This Shakespearean tragedy dramatises the damaging physical and psychological effects of political ambition on those who seek power.
Of all the plays that Shakespeare wrote during the reign of [1] [1], Macbeth most clearly reflects his relationship with King [2], patron of Shakespeare's [3] [3].

While many today would say that any misfortune surrounding a production is mere coincidence, actors and others in the theatre industry often consider it bad luck to mention Macbeth by name while inside a theatre, and sometimes refer to it indirectly, for example as "[1] [1] [1]", or "[2]", or when referring to the characters and not the play, "Mr. and Mrs. M", or "The Scottish King".
